author: gstein
msg: (svn_repos_create, get_repos, svn_repos_recover): no longer need to
store a pool in the repository structure.

author: gstein
msg: (svn_io_walk_func_t): new typedef for the walker callback
(svn_io_dir_walk): new function to "walk" a directory tree

author: cmpilato
msg: Twelve hours of tandem coding by Ben Collins-Sussman and Karl Fogel
(plus twenty minutes of fixes and cleanups and four hours of
More work for issue #689: Finish checksums for updates, checkouts, and
single-file fetches over ra_dav and ra_local (apologies to ra_svn --
we'll be filing an issue for you; your sister ra_dav was misbehaving
and required more attention from mommy and daddy).
(send_text_delta): Take new base_checksum and result_checksum args,
pass them along to the editor's apply_textdelta function.
(delta_files): Calculate checksums, pass them to send_text_delta.
(validate_element): Validate the md5 checksum prop, and just decline
unknown props, so we can add new props in the future.
(struct file_write_ctx_t): New wrapper struct for stream.
arguments, pass them through to editor's apply_textdelta
function.  Also, fix typo in comment.
(start_element): Catch checksum attributes, pass through to
simple_fetch_file, or store in report baton, as appropriate.
(fetch_file): Pass resource's result checksum to simple_fetch_file.
resource, initialize running md5 context, and wrap stream in new
file_write_ctx_t struct, which pass to custom_get_request.
(get_file_reader): Unpack the stream correctly, update the running
(add_helper): Return error instead of void.  Insert result_checksum

author: rooneg
msg: add doxygen markup to comments.  i appologize for the formatting in the
examples of svn_test_get_editor, i couldn't just wrap the whole example in
because the blank lines were causing doxygen to conclude that
the paragraph had ended, so it preemptively closed the <pre> for me... then

when i put each individual paragraph in a 
 wrapper, it decided

to insert extra

tags, so the only way to get the html docs to look like

the output actually should look was to put 
 wrappers on each
'paragraph', then remove the lines separating them.  if someone else has
a better way to do this (that's more readable in the actual comments), i'd
love to hear about it, cause i'm out of ideas.
